intro: Phaca topoensis, commonly known as the Topoense phaca, is a perennial herb native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Phaca topoensis is valued for its potential use in traditional medicine, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic applications.
